alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Eastern Alachua; Union (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 8:59PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Bradford, northeastern Alachua and southern Union Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 859 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Worthington Spring, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and excessive cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Excessive cloud-to-ground lightning is occurring. Locations impacted include... Lake Butler, Worthington Spring, Alachua, Worthington Springs, Groves, Providence, Beasley, New River, Upland Pines and Orange Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
